title: Riot Banning System.
body:
Hello all, i was recently banned for 2 weeks due to severe racism and toxicity in one of my games. And now i feel like if i even type the word f*ck i will get perma banned. Do you guys think that players should be feeling like this? I understand what i did was wrong and why i got banned, it was a deserved ban especially considering my history. But now since the ban i feel like the system of which people get punished isnt very effective as my friend has inted so many games and told so many people to kys and has never once gotten a restriction or a suspension. 
What do you guys think to both questions?
Should players feel like there is a ban hammer looming over them that if they say anything they will get banned
And do you think the system is skewed to punish those with extreme views

(Also to clarify, i was only being racist as a joke with my friends just trying to say the most extreme stuff i can, i dont actually think that whites are better than blacks etc)

There wouldn't be much point to a profanity filter if profanity was explicitly punishable, after all.
